metadata.title: CVE-2024-26901 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:do_sys_name_to_handle(): use kzalloc() to fix kernel-infoleak syzbotidentified a kernel information leak vulnerability indo_sys_name_to_handle() and issued the following report [1]. [1] "BUG:KMSAN: kernel-infoleak in instrument_copy_to_userinclude/linux/instrumented.h:114 [inline] BUG: KMSAN: kernel-infoleak in_copy_to_user+0xbc/0x100 lib/usercopy.c:40 instrument_copy_to_userinclude/linux/instrumented.h:114 [inline] _copy_to_user+0xbc/0x100lib/usercopy.c:40 copy_to_user include/linux/uaccess.h:191 [inline]do_sys_name_to_handle fs/fhandle.c:73 [inline] __do_sys_name_to_handle_atfs/fhandle.c:112 [inline] __se_sys_name_to_handle_at+0x949/0xb10fs/fhandle.c:94 __x64_sys_name_to_handle_at+0xe4/0x140 fs/fhandle.c:94 ...Uninit was created at: slab_post_alloc_hook+0x129/0xa70 mm/slab.h:768slab_alloc_node mm/slub.c:3478 [inline] __kmem_cache_alloc_node+0x5c9/0x970mm/slub.c:3517 __do_kmalloc_node mm/slab_common.c:1006 [inline]__kmalloc+0x121/0x3c0 mm/slab_common.c:1020 kmallocinclude/linux/slab.h:604 [inline] do_sys_name_to_handle fs/fhandle.c:39[inline] __do_sys_name_to_handle_at fs/fhandle.c:112 [inline]__se_sys_name_to_handle_at+0x441/0xb10 fs/fhandle.c:94__x64_sys_name_to_handle_at+0xe4/0x140 fs/fhandle.c:94 ... Bytes 18-19 of20 are uninitialized Memory access of size 20 starts at ffff888128a46380Data copied to user address 0000000020000240" Per Chuck Lever's suggestion,use kzalloc() instead of kmalloc() to solve the problem.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1125.136').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2109.115').
linux-azure-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2072.77').
